io.github.privacystreams.core

Class Stream

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.privacystreams.core.Stream
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    PStream

    public abstract class Stream
extends java.lang.Object
    Stream is one of the essential classes used in PrivacyStreams. Most personal data access/process operation in PrivacyStreams use Stream as the intermediate. A Stream is consist of one or multiple items. The items are produced by PStreamProvider functions (like LocationUpdatesProvider, CallLogProvider, etc.), transformed by PStreamTransformation functions (like filter, reorder, map, etc.), and outputted by ItemsOperator functions (like print, toList, etc.). Stream producer functions (including PStreamProvider and PStreamTransformation) should make sure the stream is not closed before writing items to it, using: stream.isClosed() Stream consumer functions (including PStreamTransformation and ItemsOperator) should stop reading from Stream if the stream is ended. If stream.read() returns a null, it means the stream is ended.

        public void write(Item item,
                  Function<?,? extends Stream> streamProvider)
        Write an item to the stream, or write a null to end the stream.
        Parameters:
        item - the item to write to the stream, null indicates the end of the stream
        streamProvider - the function that provide current stream

      • isClosed

        public boolean isClosed()
        Check whether the stream is closed, Stream generator functions should make sure the stream is not closed this writing items to it.
        Returns:
        true if the stream is closed, meaning the stream does not accept new items
